data.title: Lieutenant William Henry Snyder NICKERSON
data.text:
Citation

Images

Medals

Bio Details

Gazette Entry

William NICKERSON

Second Boer War

Citation

20th April, 1900 At Wakkerstroom, on the evening of the 20th April, 1900, during the advance of the Infantry to support the Mounted Troops, Lieutenant Nickerson went, in the most gallant manner, under a heavy rifle and shell fire, to attend a wounded man, dressed his wounds, and remained with him till he had him conveyed to a place of safety.

Medals

VC - Victoria Cross

CB

CMG

Bio Details

Born : 27 March 1875

Died : 10 (April or May) 1954

Buried : Private burial ground at his home in Cour, Kintyre, Scotland

Medical Education: Manchester University

William NICKERSON

Second Boer War

In 1925, the RAMC Association was formed to further the camaraderie of WW1 Corps veterans with Sir William Leishman being the first President. There are now some 25 branches around UK with a predominantly veteran membership although most serving Corps members also are members centrally. The Association has traditionally been supported by Corps Funds and especially for the expenses of the branch standards and standard bearers.
